title: Sky divided
text:
They say sky is limitless.
Lie?
Ignorance?
Deception?

Our skies are divided
by narrow horizons of
color and creed
gods and deed
flags and seat,
The narrow horizons
Borne
Out of the mind.

Every day
Across these horizons
I cross the borders
And walk
Beyond the territory of human creation.
Every day
Someone mightier
Builds up another wall тАУ
I hit and fall,
Everyday,
I stumble, limp
And walk again
Crossing new boundaries.

Will you join me
To break the walls?
To across all the limiting horizons?
And truly say тАУ
The sky limitless!
Republished in April 2021

title: In the operating room
text:
I am in a bed surrounded by green people: green gown, green mask, in dimly lit room. They talk gibberish. I understand only a few words: Maya, female, 28, chest, anaesthesia, Glassman, hour. They are preparing me and waiting for Dr.┬аGlassman to arrive.
тАЬMy name is Nurse Mark. You are in the operation room. Do you understand Miss Maya?тАЭ I nod my head. He seems to not understand. I say тАЬYes.тАЭ He smiles. He moves me under two big inverted-umbrella like monsters. They look like some sort of constellation of LED-lights you often see in GrayтАЩs Anatomy. Suddenly they glow and my eyes are blinded for a moment. Dr.┬аGlassman is here.
тАЬHello, Maya! How are you doing?тАЭ
тАЬOkay. Waiting it to start and get over with. You are using local, right?тАЭ
тАЬGood then. You didnтАЩt want general. So.тАЭ
тАЬIтАЩve already experienced your general anesthesia. This time I want to be awake the whole time. I want to see you operate on me. I mean, how it works.тАЭ
тАЬLetтАЩs see if you can see. You know that there will be a drape.тАЭ
Oh crap. IтАЩd forgotten about the drape. They hide my head.
тАЬOh.тАЭ

He moves the surgical display monitor here and there. (This is fancy!) I can see my chest on it. Reminds of Dashain when after beheading a goat men in the village would shave it off and apply turmeric powder on itтАЩs body before cutting it into pieces. Betadine had made my chest look just like the goatтАЩs yellow stomach. I still have my head intact and Dr.┬аGlassman is not Frankenstein.
Mark arranges drape around me. The monitor is hidden now. All I see is Green. Anaesthesia is already doing its job тАУ I can no longer feel my chest. A guy comes near my ear and says, тАЬYou will feel dizzy and a bit cold. I have given a medication.тАЭ I read his name тАЬDr.┬аTruman, AnaesthesiaтАЭ; I chuckle. Mark had opened an IV line for him in my left arm.
Wait! DidnтАЩt Dr.┬аGlassman just say local anaesthesia? Why would I feel dizzy? Did Truman just say I wonтАЩt be able to move? How will I breath then? They had already put oxygen tube in and around my nose. Am I duped into all this? God.
My head! ItтАЩs hurting now. I feel tired. Sleepy. Why are my eyelids closing? I donтАЩt want to sleep. I just want to experience everything that happens during the operation. I am here also to remind Dr.┬аGlassman to take pictures. (He has an iPhone, better than mine.) MRI images do not satisfy the eagerness of human eyes. A piece of paper with numbers on it does not give you the picture. Doctors might form an image out if it, but I have to see the thing itself. DonтАЩt you wish to see the face of your killer before he is sentenced to death? Just that you donтАЩt survive the murder attempt, and death sentences are either not possible, or are not real solutions. Still, the wish remains. Sorry, I went a bit emotional. Philosophical.
Struggling not to close the eyelids, I ask Dr.┬аGlassman how is it going there. He doesnтАЩt say a thing.
Loud. тАЬHey Doctor. I donтАЩt want to sleep. I will sing songs. Is that okay?тАЭ
тАЬHmmтАЭ
I donтАЩt know if he is talking to me or saying something to the other assisting doctor.

I donтАЩt care. I canтАЩt care. I first go with Nabin K Bhattarai: тАЬKhadai nakhako bish le jyudai maryoтАЭ. Then some of Coldplay I think. English, Nepali, Hindi all mixed up тАУ my frustrations are spelled out then: тАШFuckтАЩ, тАШMujiтАЩ, тАШMadarchodтАЩ, тАж Some ill-formed sentences to some loving motherfuckers. I get them all out. Everyone here has their own shit to care about to make the operation successful despite my practice for the audition of Nepal Idol and Himalaya Roadies.

Breathing is getting difficult. Someone is stabbing me. My chest hurts. I turn left тАУ the clock says 3:30. Does the anaesthesia wear off after 1 hour? When did they give the anaesthesia? It is all because I resisted sleep. People say sleep is important. Or maybe I just dozed off due to the anaesthesia and this is a dream. I will wake up without any pain. But what about this pain right now? Remember what Descartes said: what you feel is real. Did he really say that? Fuck Descartes. He never experienced anaesthesia. Screw all armchair philosophers who donтАЩt have any experience of altered consciousness.

Needles on my chest. Ahhh!!! No!!!
Is Dr.┬аGlassman already sewing? I clinch my fist on every penetration of the needle.
тАЬWow, the surgery was short!тАЭ
Nothing.
Louder. тАЬNo.┬аIt hurts!тАЭ
Nothing.
DonтАЩt they hear me? Am I just speaking inside my head? Or am I just, paralyzed? IтАЩll be one of those stories of patients being awake during surgeries feeling all the pain but unable to speak.

The pain is getting unbearable. In pain, minutes feel like eternity. When the pain is beyond тАШunbearableтАЩ, the concept of time evaporates into ether. It is just pain and you. I am with pain now.

тАЬCongratulations! We have removed the tumor.тАЭ Dr.┬аGlassman removes the drape and winks with his usual тАЬCancer is canceled.тАЭ
I look down where my breast used to be. Sure, тАШCancer is canceled.тАЩ

title: An apology
text:
The horrible things spoken and done
Hurt
Me,
Filled with pain and sorrow тАУ
Every walking, living shadow
Is scary
These days
I see your tears in their dark eyes
I hear you cry in their breath
Do you see me cry?
Do you hear my tears roll down?

Intolerable guilt,
The burden of regret too heavy to carry
Is crushing me
Breaking me into pieces
with some fragments of you in it.

Oh Enough.

To let me live
To set me free
and break the chain
I come to you
And declare in silence тАУ
I am sorry.
тАжI guess

title: A fresh start
text:
we made love last night
and slept alongside
tipsy with few bottles of Brouwhoeve IPA
in the warmth of each otherтАЩs bosom
dreaming a future
тАВтАВ (a happy one I imagine)
together.

this morning
quite early
earlier than usual
she wakes up before I do
dressed up in her new pants
тАВтАВ (those were my gifts in her birthday last week)
decides to leave
yeah, leave.

she takes the first flight
to abandon the city
тАВтАВ (would she abandon me?
тАВтАВ i was a good lover тАУ she had said last week)
and flies to тАШherтАЩ new place
тАВтАВ (she is already тАШmoving onтАЩ there,
тАВтАВ someone texted me)
while I am cold and
still in this warm bed
stripped
out of the dreams, fresh ones
we had dreamt together.

I ruminate
over
her voice
тАВтАВ (and fantasies i had listened to)
her face
тАВтАВ (and lips i had kissed on)
the love
we had and
we madeтАУ
this schism
tears
me
apartтАУ
I cry
few drops of semen. Ah.

Ah.
I start
a New day, now
a Fresh one
with a scotch of whiskeyтАУ
in the Irish pub next door
a sixty-five-year-old pensioner
joins me with a bottle of Backbone Splitter.
I hate beer!
(Bang)
Republished in April 2021

title: The joy of hunting
text:
A dark room in some random city
In the middle of nowhere
There lives a man
тАВтАВ (Just living, not alive)
Surely he lives there
тАЩcause no one has bothered to kill him тАжyet!

The monotonous chore of life
As long as he can remember
Has made him dark
In and out.

Thank god тАУ
тАВтАВ (Or rather not)
For he was educated beyond his intelligence.
Now in the darkness
Somehow,
he manages to drag through his daily chore.
What a pity!

I met him yesterday
Such a resentful man he is тАУ
Complains about every single way he has been treated
тАВтАВ (and has not been treated)
Every other thing he ever experienced
тАВтАВ (and he never experienced)
In this middle of nowhere!
IтАЩd never want to see such a miserable person again.

I had a gun
тАВтАВ (But whoтАЩd waste a bullet to drag that dolour down)
On my way to hunting тАУ
Ah, what a joy it was.
Republished in April 2021

title: My melanin
text:
Beauty is in the eyes of beholder you say,
You define beauty,
A quality one.
You classify beautiful,
An attractive one.
Disgusting is instinctive to you,
Ugly is intuitive to you.
Oh dear,
Now I board
on with your eyes.

You find something off with my nose
Are they protruded too much?
My face screams not enough
Are the eyes in the right place?
Even my bookshelves howl my ugliness тАУ
I canтАЩt fetch you,
The Book on The Bookshelf
A hundred-paged Kamashutra.
Oh, the kind one тАУ
You still
behold me
in your eyes.

What do these beholderтАЩs eyes say,
oh the kind one?
тАВтАВIt was not something that was off ?
тАВтАВNot the bookshelves that revealed my ugliness ?
тАВтАВNot the face that screamed ugly ?
A chromatic affinity?
All not white is what I have.
Mud is what I am,
Alas it disgusted you тАУ
Melanin in my skin.

title: Nobody-s
text:
1 Who are you? Are you nobody?
┬а┬а┬а┬а┬а┬а Yes, I am nobody.
Oh, I am also nobody.
┬а┬а┬а┬а┬а┬а I see.

Really? I only see somebody in everybody.
 (Well, you said you are nobody though,
 Or is it I who insisted?

There is always somebody in everybody, but not me.

to speak out

title: Strangers again

Congratulations!
We made a full circle today

title: Glimpsing through Meditation
text: I was first introduced to formal practice of meditation when I was in lower secondory school. After that there were many instances of following spiritual schools and gurus for the sake of learning how to meditate. It was never consistent and I was never consistent. In the past few months, I have been fairly consistent meditating just by myself. Without a teacher, however, learning the skill of meditation is not an easy task to undertake. After weighing the pros and cons, I decided to learn from a teacher, from someone who is trained and knows better, someone who can teach. I came across this app by Sam Harris in which there are different courses and routes of meditation practice including one for beginners. [Sam is generally known for his expression on politics, philosophy and religion. But this is not my concern at the moment.] Today marks the 25th day of my regular practice of following the guided meditation. I would recommend it to anyone. With the practice, I have begun to realize those aspects of тАШmyselfтАЩ that had gone unnoticed earlier, or had been noticed in readings. I have questions about life and existence, about self and consciousness more than ever before. Probably this also depends on what one seeks from meditation. Why do you (want to) meditate? Do you think that meditation is the remedy to all the problems in your life: stress, negative emotions, anger and so on? Maybe this is not the right approach to meditation, I opine. I definitely do not qualify to make a seasoned claim. But gleaning what I have glimpsed in recent days and what I had learnt from my intermittent practice in the past is that meditation is not the means to attain those ends. Meditation, I think, is about being mindful of the existence тАУ existence of thoughts, emotions, feelings, sensations in oneтАЩs conscious awareness. Realizing and observing that all what we experience in our waking hours (probably while we sleep as well) are merely the appearance of those experiences in the field of conscious awareness. And we identify this experience as тАШselfтАЩ, an illusory self. This realization, even if momentary in the beginning, is enlightening [I am not using the word тАШenlighteningтАЩ in the same sense that is used in different Buddhits and Hindu traditions.] I canтАЩt say for sure if I am under an illusion that I have glimpsed it: there are instances during meditation when I have momentarily observed the non-existence of тАШselfтАЩ; there is no тАШIтАЩ. This might as well an illusion at the end. With time and practice, things will be clearer for me. Afterall, you can see how many times the word тАШIтАЩ has been used in this writing тАУ the self is so dominant. And semantics does matter, doesnтАЩt it?

title: A bit of git-ting
text:
The first thing that I do for any data analyses or writing project is create a remote git repository either in github or in gitlab. Then I create a local R project in R Studio, and connect it to the remote git repo. The тАШhow-toтАЩ of this process can be found online; IтАЩll write up a brief overview, probably.
This post is to remind myself of most frequently used git commands.


# Push local changes to the remote repo:
git push -u origin master

# Creat and checkout new branch:
git checkout -b NewBranchName

git push -u origin BranchIamWorkingOn # to push from local repo to remote repo if the remote repo doesn't have this `BranchIamWorkinOn` setup up already

# Delete a local branch:
git branch -D BranchToBeDeleted

Be careful on deleting. The -D is a hard delete!
Merge branches locally:

git checkout main #First switch to the main/master branch
git merge BranchIwantToMerge #The branch still exists after merging

This was a dirty note down ;)
Other frequently used commands are git pull, git merge, git rm -r --cached, etc.
Tune in for notes on frequently used R, bash and git commands.
